intro: Erodium baeticum, commonly known as the Iberian stormweed, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its small, pinkish to purple flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has pinnately divided leaves and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. It is an annual herb that thrives in Mediterranean climates. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in southern Spain.
